thread.title: Chavis: Initial grade for Texas A&M linebackers 'wouldn't be very good'
thread.title_full: Chavis: Initial grade for Texas A&M linebackers 'wouldn't be very good' | Dallas Morning News

author: Kate Hairopoulos
title: Chavis: Initial grade for Texas A&M linebackers 'wouldn't be very good'
text:
NO. 21 MISSISSIPPI STATE (3-1, 1-1 SEC) AT NO. 14 TEXAS A&M (4-0, 1-0) 6:30 p.m. Saturday (SEC)
Texas A&M defensive coordinator John Chavis admitted that the early grade for the linebacking corps "wouldn't be very good, to be honest with you."
Arkansas rushed for 232 yards against A&M, in part, Chavis said, because the defensive line was getting too far upfield trying to rush the passer, then the linebackers didn't seal the gaps as quickly as needed.
A&M's linebackers have gone through an array of injuries and a suspension. Otaro Alaka appeared to get banged up in the Arkansas game, and coach Kevin Sumlin wouldn't update his status this week.
"From a technical standpoint, we've got some learning that we need to accelerate," Chavis said.
Follow Kate Hairopoulos on Twitter at @khairopoulos .
